title: Bloomberg: Apple Watch Series 7 to Feature Thinner Display Borders and U1 Ultra Wideband
content:
For this year's Apple Watch Series 7, Apple has tested thinner display borders and a new lamination technique that brings the display closer to the front cover, according to Bloomberg's Mark Gurman.


From the report:
For this year’s model, Apple has tested thinner display borders and a new lamination technique that brings the display closer to the front cover. The new Watch is likely to be slightly thicker overall, but not in a way that’s noticeable to the user.
The model will also include updated ultra-wideband functionality, the same underlying technology in the Apple AirTag item finder, according to Gurman, although added biometric sensors are likely to be pushed back to a successor model.

Apple had previously aimed to put a body temperature sensor in this year’s model, but that is now more likely to be included in the 2022 update. The blood-sugar sensor, which would help diabetics monitor their glucose levels, is unlikely to be ready for commercial launch for several more years.
